snippet: Microsoft may soon be one of the first cloud-computing companies in the United States to let Europeans store their online data closer to home.
abstract: Microsoft chief executive Satya Nadella announces company will begin using data centers in Germany in order to address concerns raised by European authorities about privacy of Europeans' data in light of revelations about United States government surveillance.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft may soon be one of the first cloud-computing companies in the United States to let Europeans store their online data closer to home.

headline.main: Microsoft May Let Europeans Store Data Closer to Home
headline.print_headline: Microsoft to Use Data Sites in Germany to Ease Fears
